page.title: 01GAZETTE OF SLOUGH
page.content: This grid contains a large part of Slough's housing, concentrated in the NE of the town. Much of it, built in the 1930's, is closely packed housing separated by large parks & open space. Slough is full to bursting - the buildings go right up to the borough (& County) boundaries. Northwards the existing farmland & landuse is preserved by the Green Belt. Farming is typical of the urban fringe with "horseyculture" common. Much land is for private recreation such as the Golf Club at Stoke Park and the Club at Stoke Place. This area has the few remaining historic buildings such as Stoke Poges Church & the country houses, now used for businesses or for recreation. Facilities such as the large hospital, crematorium & cattle market are found right at this edge of town.
